bug.author: unsolicitedcrap
bug.summary: Example code in "Add widgets to sidebar" is wrong
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://streamlit.io/docs/api.html#add-widgets-to-sidebar>https://streamlit.io/docs/api.html#add-widgets-to-sidebar</denchmark-link>
Name of the Streamlit feature whose docs need improvement: <denchmark-code>add_selectbox = st.sidebar.checkbox( 'How would you like to be contacted?', ('Email', 'Home phone', 'Mobile phone')) ) </denchmark-code>
What you think the docs should say: <denchmark-code>add_selectbox = st.sidebar.radio( 'How would you like to be contacted?', ('Email', 'Home phone', 'Mobile phone')) </denchmark-code>
Modifications include:
Change checkbox to radio Remove extra closing parenthesis

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/unsolicitedcrap>@unsolicitedcrap</denchmark-link> -- yeah, that's definitely not right! We could also fix this by replacing with the following if we wanted to keep talking about checkboxes in our example: <denchmark-code>st.sidebar.markdown('How would you like to be contacted?') checkboxes = [] for item in ('Email', 'Home phone', 'Mobile phone'): checkboxes.append(st.sidebar.checkbox(item)) </denchmark-code>
I'm not sure checkboxes in particular are what's being put on display here, so chances are your replacement code (plus some adjustment to the prior language so it says "radio" instead of "checkbox") is probably a good solution.
Currently the docs only have an extra parens <denchmark-code>add_selectbox = st.sidebar.selectbox( 'How would you like to be contacted?', ('Email', 'Home phone', 'Mobile phone')) ) </denchmark-code>
